channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1855] bin/client not working properly after installing 6.1 p2
item.description:
After installing patch 2 fully (i.e. also updating lib/bin/karaf-client.jar as instructed in the patch readme), the bin/client script does not work anymore.

It raises 

org.apache.sshd.SshClient.connect(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;I)Lorg/apache/sshd/client/future/ConnectFuture;
item.summary: bin/client not working properly after installing 6.1 p2

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The above error can be resolved by updating the bin/client script with the patched artifacts as follows:

Change from 

CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/sshd/sshd-core/0.9.0/sshd-core-0.9.0.jar"
 
CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/karaf/shell/org.apache.karaf.shell.console/2.3.0.redhat-610379/org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-610379.jar"

to

CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/sshd/sshd-core/0.11.0/sshd-core-0.11.0.jar"
 
CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/karaf/shell/org.apache.karaf.shell.console/2.3.0.redhat-610387/org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-610387.jar"

This gets you to a point where you can log in with the bin/client script.

However things break again if you create a Fabric:

  • Create a fabric 

    fabric:create --wait-for-provisioning --verbose --profile fabric

  • try bin/client -u admin -p admin again, it now raises 

      Logging in as admin
    		 
    616 [pool-2-thread-3] WARN org.apache.sshd.client.keyverifier.AcceptAllServerKeyVerifier - Server at [/0.0.0.0:8101, DSA, bf:3e:a0:73:0f:e9:39:c7:e4:2b:35:e0:c6:10:12:31] presented unverified {} key: {}
    		 
    Authentication failed

There is another related problem that can be reproduced using these steps. Not clear if this behavior is caused by the same bug or not.

  • Take fresh 6.1, start it and install p2 using patch:add and patch:install. Don't update lib/bin/karaf-client.jar as instructed by the patch readme.txt.
  • Stop the container, delete instances and data directories
  • Start the container in the background using bin/start
  • Issue the following command "./client -u admin -p admin -r 60 'fabric:create --clean --wait-for-provisioning --verbose --profile fabric'"
  • Issue any new client command "./client -u admin -p admin -r 60 'help'"
  • The client command is blocked. The client does not get the Karaf welcome screen. If you try to open the Hawtio login screen (http://localhost:8181) you get an empty page.
    However if you try again after around 1 minute or so, hawtio seems to work and re-running client -u admin -p admin works as well.
    This behavior is not observed with 6.1 GA.

In data/log/karaf.log there is loads of additional logging after around 1 min, starting with an exception that looks like a timeout [1].
"Caused by: java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Cannot provision container in time"

and thereafter many bundles get redeployed.
So even though the fabric:create command also sets --wait-for-provisioning, there is additional provisioning happening in the background that seems to be delayed due to patch 2. And unless this provisioning has finished, attempts to login to the Karaf console or hawtio block.

[1]

2014-08-28 09:26:46,360 | INFO  | pool-16-thread-6 | ShellCommandFactory              | ShellCommandFactory$ShellCommand  137 | 39 - org.apache.karaf.shell.ssh - 2.3.0.redhat-610387 | Exception caught while executing command
 
io.fabric8.api.FabricException: Unable to create zookeeper server configuration
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.create(ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.java:138)
 
	at io.fabric8.boot.commands.CreateAction.doExecute(CreateAction.java:247)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.console.AbstractAction.execute(AbstractAction.java:33)
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.commands.basic.AbstractCommand.execute(AbstractCommand.java:35)
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.CommandProxy.execute(CommandProxy.java:78)[15:org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime:0.11.0.redhat-610379]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.executeCmd(Closure.java:477)[15:org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime:0.11.0.redhat-610379]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.executeStatement(Closure.java:403)[15:org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime:0.11.0.redhat-610379]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Pipe.run(Pipe.java:108)[15:org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime:0.11.0.redhat-610379]

	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.execute(Closure.java:120)[15:org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime:0.11.0.redhat-610379]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.CommandSessionImpl.execute(CommandSessionImpl.java:89)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.ssh.ShellCommandFactory$ShellCommand$1.run(ShellCommandFactory.java:117)
 
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.jaas.modules.JaasHelper.doAs(JaasHelper.java:67)[40:org.apache.karaf.jaas.modules:2.3.0.redhat-610387]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.ssh.ShellCommandFactory$ShellCommand.start(ShellCommandFactory.java:115)[39:org.apache.karaf.shell.ssh:2.3.0.redhat-610387]
 
	at org.apache.sshd.server.channel.ChannelSession.handleExec(ChannelSession.java:409)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]
 
	at org.apache.sshd.server.channel.ChannelSession.handleRequest(ChannelSession.java:291)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]

	at org.apache.sshd.server.channel.ChannelSession$ChannelSessionRequestHandler.process(ChannelSession.java:546)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]
 
	at org.apache.sshd.common.channel.AbstractChannel.handleRequest(AbstractChannel.java:96)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]
 
	at org.apache.sshd.common.session.AbstractConnectionService.channelRequest(AbstractConnectionService.java:261)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]

	at org.apache.sshd.common.session.AbstractSession.doHandleMessage(AbstractSession.java:399)[25:org.apache.sshd.core:0.11.0]

	at sun.nio.ch.Invoker$2.run(Invoker.java:206)[:1.7.0_45]
 
	at sun.nio.ch.AsynchronousChannelGroupImpl$1.run(AsynchronousChannelGroupImpl.java:112)[:1.7.0_45]

Caused by: java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Cannot provision container in time
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl$BootstrapCreateHandler.waitForSuccessfulDeploymentOf(ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.java:357)
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl$BootstrapCreateHandler.access$100(ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.java:286)
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.create(ZooKeeperClusterBootstrapImpl.java:133)
 
	... 34 more

The bug ENTESB-1535 relates to extending the patching mechanism. Now the only workaround is to manually patch feature definition files by using the attached patch (made by turning FUSE_HOME/system dir a git repository).

Torsten Mielke I've checked this issue once again and:

Here's what I did

  1. I've started fresh installation of jboss-fuse-full-6.1.0.redhat-379.zip using bin/fuse
  2. patch:add file:///data/downloads/jboss.org/fuse/jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2.zip
  3. patch:install jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2
  4. shutdown
  5. restart. After manual replacement of lib/bin/karaf-client.jar I wasn't able to connect with bin/client
  6. After tweaking bin/client script (correct versions of sshd-core-0.11.0.jar and org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-610387.jar, I was able to connect
  7. After fabric:create I had the problems with bin/client again, because osgi bundle versions were restored from 387 back to 379
  8. I patched the fabric environment then:
    1. version-create 1.1
    2. patch-apply --username admin --password admin --version 1.1 file:///data/downloads/jboss.org/fuse/jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2.zip
    3. container-upgrade 1.1 root
  9. I could connect using bin/client once again

I hope this helps

Thanks for testing Grzegorz,

I ran the same steps as in your above comment and confirm the very same behavior.
However I get into problems using the following series of steps

0. Start fresh installation from jboss-fuse-full-6.1.0.redhat-379.zip
1. fabric:create
2. version-create 1.1
3. patch-apply --username admin --password admin --version 1.1 file:///path/to/jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2.zip
4. container-upgrade 1.1 root
5. client -u admin -p admin works
5. copy karaf-client.jar from patch to lib/bin
6. modify bin/client script to use sshd-core-0.11.0.jar and org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-610387.jar
7. client -u admin -p admin now fails with 

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/sshd/agent/SshAgentFactory
 
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
 
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:2531)
 
	at java.lang.Class.getMethod0(Class.java:2774)
 
	at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:1663)
 
	at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.getMainMethod(LauncherHelper.java:494)
 
	at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(LauncherHelper.java:486)
 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.sshd.agent.SshAgentFactory
 
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366)
 
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
 
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
 
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354)
 
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:425)
 
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308)
 
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)
 
	... 6 more

There still seems to be a problem here. Not sure why it did not come up in your series of steps that also work for me.
Good point, I just did restart the container but the problem remains. The client script continues to fail with the above error.

Error can be resolved by updating the bin/client script with the patched artifacts as follows:

CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/sshd/sshd-core/0.12.0.redhat-002/sshd-core-0.12.0.redhat-002.jar"
 
CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/karaf/shell/org.apache.karaf.shell.console/2.3.0.redhat-611423/org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-611423.jar"

Lenka, using what patch file exactly did you test the solution? I tested with 6.1 p2 and did update the classpath to point to the patched sshd-core and karaf shell console jar files as per comment above. That did not help much in my tests.

Hmm, I tested the scenario and it worked. I didn't use newer patches however.
Remember that creating fabric brings a set of bundles to pre-patched state - you have to patch fabric then.

I tried the exact scenario and I see the difference. I used jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-r1.zip, not jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p1.zip.
After applying R1, I don't see $FUSE/system/org/apache/sshd/sshd-core/0.11.0 directory, only 0.8.0 and 0.9.0.
If you check R1, everything works fine.
Maybe patching mechanism is broken somehow?
This however shows that correct version is used:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> list -t 0 -s | grep sshd
 
[ 264] [Active     ] [            ] [       ] [   60] org.apache.sshd.core (0.11.0)
Assigning to you Torsten Mielke as from dev's side everything's ok

Okay, got it working on both patches r1 and r2.
When applying the patch to a Fabric managed container, the patched sshd-core and org.apache.karaf.shell.console jars are not copied to the system/ folder of the installation.
They are uploaded to the Fabric maven proxy and as such live in data/maven/proxy.

The readme of these patches however tells you to change the client script's CLASSPATH to point to e.g.

CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/sshd/sshd-core/0.11.0/sshd-core-0.11.0.jar"
 
CLASSPATH="$CLASSPATH:$KARAF_HOME/system/org/apache/karaf/shell/org.apache.karaf.shell.console/2.3.0.redhat-610394/org.apache.karaf.shell.console-2.3.0.redhat-610394.jar"

but this location does not exist until the user manually copies these files to the above location.
Once that is done the client script works fine.

Readme of latest patch rollup2 will be updated. However this also affects previous patches, any patches from p2 upwards.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• Install and start a fresh 6.1
  • install 6.1 patch 2 

      patch:add 'file:///tmp/jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2.zip'
    		 
      patch:install jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-379-p2

  • As instructed in the patch readme.txt, replace {$FUSE_HOME}/lib/bin/karaf-client.jar with karaf-client.jar from the patch file
  • Restart JBoss Fuse
  • Attempt to connect to the container using the client command 

    bin/client -u admin -p admin%

    This raises 

    Logging in as admin
    		 
    org.apache.sshd.SshClient.connect(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;I)Lorg/apache/sshd/client/future/ConnectFuture;
